page.title: 04Chatteris - Horseway History
page.content:
We talked to an old lady who was born at Horseway. She told us that in 1903 between the Sixteen Foot Bridge and Horseway Bridge there were six thatched cottages that burnt down and were never rebuilt. The lady, who was born in one of the cottages, said that her father was a pig man for the local farmer and that other people in the row worked on the land. After the fire she moved to the Paddy House which was built in the second field south of the lock. The house was named after the Irish workers who came to dig the dykes that drained the fenland.
On Sundays the local community attended Horseway Chapel. This was between Horseway Bridge and Coulson's Farm and was attached to the Parish Church.
